message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the combustion of ethane (C2H6) in the presence of oxygen (O2) to produce carbon dioxide (CO2) and water (H2O)?
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the combustion of ethane (C2H6) in the presence of oxygen (O2) to produce carbon dioxide (CO2) and water (H2O) is:

2C2H6 + 7O2 â†’ 4CO2 + 6H2O
